description:
This is a library module offering a part of the set of statistical functions
 defined by Microsoft Excel 2003.

functions.name: avedev
functions.description:
Returns the average of the absolute deviations of data points from their mean.
 The formula is sum(abs(x - average_x))/n, where n is the count of x in the sequence.
functions.summary: Returns the average of the absolute deviations of data points from their mean.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. Sequence can be of any length from 1 up.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: average
functions.description:
Returns the average (arithmetic mean) of the arguments.
 Arguments can be empty values, otherwise must be castable to numeric.
 If sequence is empty then zero is returned.
 The sequence can be of any length.
functions.summary: Returns the average (arithmetic mean) of the arguments.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of numbers or empty values.

returns.description: The sum of all numbers divided by the number of non-empty values.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: averagea
functions.description:
Calculates the average (arithmetic mean) of the values in the sequence of arguments.
 Arguments can be of any type.
 The numbers are added, and the sum is divided by the size of entire sequence.
functions.summary: Calculates the average (arithmetic mean) of the values in the sequence of arguments.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of values of any type. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

functions.name: count
functions.description: Counts the number of cells that contain numbers or values castable to numeric.
functions.summary: Counts the number of cells that contain numbers or values castable to numeric.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of values, of any length.

functions.name: counta
functions.description:
Counts the number of values that are not empty.
 Empty values are the one with string value "".
functions.summary: Counts the number of values that are not empty.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of values of any type, any length

functions.name: countblank
functions.description:
Counts the empty values in a sequence.
 The empty values are the ones with string value "".
 The value 0 is not counted.
functions.summary: Counts the empty values in a sequence.

parameters.name: cells
parameters.description: the sequence of values, of any length

functions.name: large
functions.signature: ($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $k as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Returns the k-th largest value in a data set.
 If n is the number of data points in a range,
   then LARGE(array,1) returns the largest value,
   and LARGE(array,n) returns the smallest value.
functions.summary: Returns the k-th largest value in a data set.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: k
parameters.description: the position of largest value, with value from 1 to count of values

returns.description: The k-th largest value as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if the sequence is empty</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if k is not a value between 1 and the sequence size</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: max
functions.description: Returns the largest number in a sequence.
functions.summary: Returns the largest number in a sequence.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: maxa
functions.description:
Returns the largest value in a list of arguments.
 In this implementation there is no difference between MAX and MAXA.
functions.summary: Returns the largest value in a list of arguments.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: median
functions.description:
Returns the median of the given numbers.
 The median is the number in the middle of a set of numbers.
 Half the numbers have values that are greater than the median,
 and half the numbers have values that are less than the median.
functions.summary: Returns the median of the given numbers.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers, of any length

returns.description: for odd count of numbers return the number in the middle of the sorted sequence. For even count of numbers return the average of the two numbers in the middle.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: min
functions.description: Returns the smallest number in a sequence.
functions.summary: Returns the smallest number in a sequence.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: mina
functions.description:
Returns the smallest value in a list of arguments.
 In this implementation there is no difference between MAX and MAXA.
functions.summary: Returns the smallest value in a list of arguments.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: mode
functions.description:
Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in a sequence.
 Arguments must be castable to numeric.
functions.summary: Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in a sequence.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers, of any length

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">fn:QName("http://zorba.io/modules/excel/errors", "excel-err:NA") if there are no duplicate numbers</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: percentile
functions.signature: ($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $k_at as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Returns the k-th percentile of values in a sequence.
 If k is not a multiple of 1/(n - 1),
   PERCENTILE interpolates to determine the value at the k-th percentile.
 The function is computed by (max-min)*k + min
functions.summary: Returns the k-th percentile of values in a sequence.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers, of any length

parameters.name: k_at
parameters.description: the percentile, with value between 0 .. 1 inclusive

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if percentile is not between 0 .. 1</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: percentrank
functions.signature: ($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $x as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:decimal
functions.description:
Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set. If x does not match one of the values in array, PERCENTRANK interpolates to return the correct percentage rank.

The formula is uses: (RANK - 1) / (size - 1) .
functions.summary: Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: is the value for which you want to know the rank

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if the sequence is zero length</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: prob
functions.signature: ($x_range as xs:anyAtomicType+, $prob_range as xs:anyAtomicType+, $range_lower_limit as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
This is the same as above, only that upper_limit is not specified.
 The probability is computed only for range_lower_limit.
functions.summary: This is the same as above, only that upper_limit is not specified.

parameters.name: x_range
parameters.description: is the range of numeric values of x with which there are associated probabilities. This does not need to be ordered.

parameters.name: prob_range
parameters.description: is a set of probabilities associated with values in x_range.

parameters.name: range_lower_limit
parameters.description: is the value for which you want a probability.

returns.description: The probability of the range_lower_limit value

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if any probability is not between 0 and 1</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if the sum of probabilities is not equal to 1</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if any parameter is not castable to numeric</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: prob
functions.signature: ($x_range as xs:anyAtomicType+, $prob_range as xs:anyAtomicType+, $range_lower_limit as xs:anyAtomicType, $upper_limit as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description: Returns the probability that values in a range are between two limits.
functions.summary: Returns the probability that values in a range are between two limits.

parameters.name: x_range
parameters.description: is the range of numeric values of x with which there are associated probabilities. This does not need to be ordered.

parameters.name: prob_range
parameters.description: is a set of probabilities associated with values in x_range.

parameters.name: range_lower_limit
parameters.description: is the lower bound on the value for which you want a probability.

parameters.name: upper_limit
parameters.description: is the upper bound on the value for which you want a probability.

returns.description: The probability of the entire range

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if any probability is not between 0 and 1</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if the sum of probabilities is not equal to 1</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if any parameter is not castable to numeric</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: quartile
functions.signature: ($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $quart as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description: Returns the quartile of a data set.
functions.summary: Returns the quartile of a data set.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: sequence of numbers or values castable to numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: quart
parameters.description:
one of the values 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 with meaning:
0
compute minimum value
1
compute first quartile (25th percentile)
2
compute median value (50th percentile)
3
compute third quartile (75th percentile)
4
compute maximum value

returns.description: the computed quartile, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if the sequence is zero length</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if $quart is not one of the values 0, 1, 2, 3, 4</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: rank
functions.signature: ($x as xs:anyAtomicType, $numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:decimal
functions.description: This RANK function is same as the above, only that $order_ascending is set by default to false.
functions.summary: This RANK function is same as the above, only that $order_ascending is set by default to false.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The number whose rank you want to find.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numbers. The sequence can be of any length.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: rank
functions.signature: ($x as xs:anyAtomicType, $numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $order_ascending as xs:boolean) as xs:decimal
functions.description:
Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers.
 The rank of a number is its size relative to other values in a list.
 (If you were to sort the list, the rank of the number would be its position.)
 RANK gives duplicate numbers the same rank.
functions.summary: Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The number whose rank you want to find.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of numbers or values castable to numbers. The sequence can be of any length.

parameters.name: order_ascending
parameters.description:
A boolean having the meaning:
false
then rank the number as if the sequence was sorted in descending order.
true
then rank the number as if the sequence was sorted in ascending order.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: slope
functions.signature: ($known_y as xs:anyAtomicType+, $known_x as xs:anyAtomicType+) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Returns the slope of the linear regression line through data points in known_y's and known_x's. The slope is the vertical distance divided by the horizontal distance between any two points on the line, which is the rate of change along the regression line. It computes the formula:

sum((x - average_x)(y - average_y)) / sum((x - average_x)^2)

where average_x and average_y are computed with AVERAGE function.
functions.summary: Returns the slope of the linear regression line through data points in known_y's and known_x's.

parameters.name: known_y
parameters.description: the sequence of y numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: known_x
parameters.description: the sequence of x numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: The slope value, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if any parameter cannot be casted to numeric</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">fn:QName("http://zorba.io/modules/excel/errors", "excel-err:NA") if there are different numbers of x's and y's</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">fn:QName("http://zorba.io/modules/excel/errors", "excel-err:NA") if any sequence is empty</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Div0 if all x's are equal</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: small
functions.signature: ($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $k as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
This function computes the k-th smallest value in a data set.
 Use this function to return values with a particular relative standing in a data set.
 If n is the number of data points in array, SMALL(array,1) equals the smallest value,
   and SMALL(array,n) equals the largest value.
functions.summary: This function computes the k-th smallest value in a data set.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: A sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: k
parameters.description: The position (from the smallest) in the sequence of data to return. Must have value between 1 and size of sequence.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if the sequence is zero length.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if $k is not a value between 1 and the size of sequence.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: standardize
functions.signature: ($x as xs:anyAtomicType, $mean as xs:anyAtomicType, $standard_dev as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:double
functions.description:
Returns a normalized value from a distribution characterized by mean and standard_dev.

The formula is (x - mean) / standard_dev .
functions.summary: Returns a normalized value from a distribution characterized by mean and standard_dev.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: is the value you want to normalize

parameters.name: mean
parameters.description: is the arithmetic mean of the distribution.

parameters.name: standard_dev
parameters.description: is the standard deviation of the distribution.

returns.description: The normalized x, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if any parameter cannot be casted to numeric</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if standard_dev is a value smaller than zero or equal</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: var
functions.description:
Estimates variance based on a sample.

The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1).

average_x is computed with AVERAGE function.

n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.
functions.summary: Estimates variance based on a sample.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: vara
functions.description:
Estimates variance based on a sample.

The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1).

average_x is computed with AVERAGE function.

n is the size of sequence, including empty values.
functions.summary: Estimates variance based on a sample.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: varp
functions.description:
Calculates variance based on the entire population.

The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n.

average_x is computed with AVERAGE function.

n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.
functions.summary: Calculates variance based on the entire population.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: varpa
functions.description:
Calculates variance based on the entire population.

The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n.

average_x is computed with AVERAGE function.

n is the size of sequence, including empty values.
functions.summary: Calculates variance based on the entire population.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>
